snippet: The founders of Instagram, now multimillionaires after Facebook bought their app this week, were helped along the way by the tight web in the Bay Area tech scene.
abstract: Success of Kevin Systrom and Mike Krieger, multimillionaires after selling their Instragram photo application to Facebook, depended on their connections to the Bay Area's tight-knit tech scene; network is centered around developers and investors who attended Stanford University, and who hold entrepreneurial risk-taking in high regard.

byline.original: By SOMINI SENGUPTA, NICOLE PERLROTH and JENNA WORTHAM
byline.contributor: Evelyn M. Rusli and Nick Bilton contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The founders of Instagram, now multimillionaires after Facebook bought their app this week, were helped along the way by the tight web in the Bay Area tech scene.

headline.seo: Instagram Founders Were Helped by Bay Area Connections
headline.main: Behind Instagram’s Success, Networking the Old Way
headline.print_headline: Behind Instagram Feat, Networking the Old Way
